function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Cultural differences in perceiving and understanding recommendations for the built environment","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Economic constraints impacting sustainable social development and vector-free built environment","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exchange of information in public health forums may lead to the spread of misinformation or unverified strategies for malaria control.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of coordination and standardization among institutions and organizations may lead to fragmented and inconsistent approaches to malaria control.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited accessibility to the knowledge management platform may hinder the dissemination of critical information and best practices for malaria control.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of research and data on improving building health impacts and public awareness campaigns","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Economic constraints associated with generating public awareness","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of relevant information integration into decision-making processes","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of specific actions for health in the nua","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Data gap at the local level","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of cooperation between stakeholders","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate housing, poor sanitation, and waste management in urban areas","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Air quality failing who guidelines in urban areas","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of specific actions in the nua regarding health and the built environment","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Demolition waste in landfills creating favorable breeding conditions for mosquitoes","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of awareness on the link between demolition waste management and risk of vbds","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Urbanization leading to increased impact on health","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Buildings constructed with traditional materials becoming more susceptible to mosquito intrusion.","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Stagnant water accumulation in excavated areas providing favorable sites for mosquito larvae to mature.","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact of indoor air quality and human comfort on the risk of malaria in retrofits, repairs, and building modifications.","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Sharing proper techniques for installation and appropriate materials for piping to ensure long lifespan and minimal need for repair.","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Close proximity to dams, dilapidated buildings, and swamps increases disease prevalence","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Buildings constructed using traditional materials are susceptible to mosquito intrusion","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Poor iaq can increase the risk of respiratory diseases.","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reduced air exchanges due to modified building openings can lead to increased outdoor time and higher risk of mosquito exposure in malarious areas.","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of close synergies with built environment professionals during building envelope modifications can compromise indoor air quality.","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation rates due to building modifications","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of synergy in building envelop modifications","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unfavorable conditions for humans due to changes in building openings","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Leakage from temporary water supply points or improperly drained stormwater","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ease of mosquito access to buildings through design features","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Poor indoor air quality iaq due to modifications in building openings","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Leakage from temporary water supply points or improperly drained storm water","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Malaria-causing mosquitoes access buildings through inlets and outlets, designed for air exchange","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Changes in global wind patterns and increased rainfall propagate the spread of malaria","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Changes in global wind patterns and increased rainfall can propagate the spread of malaria during the construction life cycle.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased precipitation, relative humidity, and temperature conditions can create a more suitable habitat for the malaria vector.","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Pools of stagnant water developing in areas of intense excavation and earth removal work during the construction phase provide breeding grounds for malaria-causing mosquitoes.","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Selection of a site near an open surface water body increasing the number of breeding sites for the malaria vector","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Placement and size of building openings affecting vector accessibility","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of materials that increase vector attraction into the site","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Malnourished children under 5 at higher risk of contracting malaria due to food scarcity and limited access to public health information.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Belief in spiritual causes of illness and rejection of proposed modifications to houses for disease prevention.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased urbanization correlated with increased malaria infections in affected regions.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Malnourishment of children under 5 due to fathers holding the right to eating first in areas with scarce food","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increase in population leading to compounded health problems and greater demand for healthcare services","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increase in population leading to higher human-human contact and human-environment contact","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Social determinants of health influencing malaria prevalence","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Data paucity for actionable insights on the magnitude and complexity of malaria risk factors.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Population growth and urbanization contributing to the risk of malaria transmission in the global south.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"}]}
